website_summaries.verdict: A lightweight recreational ping-pong paddle that won't break your budget.
pros: Consists of pips-in rubber on both sides for a good offense
Five-ply blade is flexible and lightweight
Handle is flared to provide a good grip
cons: It's a beginner racket that will degrade over time

customer_reviews.title: Amazing Joola Paddle for Spin!
customer_reviews.text: I love this Joola paddle! I have used others, but this one generates speed and spin. This is for a more advanced player as the ball can easily fly off the end of the table if not. Great paddle and has a little more weight than some of the other ones.
customer_reviews.author: lauren lehrner

customer_reviews.title: I am now undefeated against my dad and girlfriend
customer_reviews.text: This is a great paddle. My game improved a LOT in terms of ball CONTROL and SPIN. I beat my dad every time by a factor of 3-1 in score. I can now do all kinds of spin shots and much better control.
customer_reviews.author: Eddie B.

customer_reviews.title: STINKY Handle
customer_reviews.text: Paddle has a lot of spin, but probably not the best for beginners. On a very negative note - the handle stinks really bad. I'm having to wash my hands after every time I touch it. Smells like the paddle was submerged in a bath of rotten lobsters.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher

customer_reviews.title: Fast Power
customer_reviews.text: It is very quick and responsive. I'm more of a spinner so I'd probably go to a spin specific paddle next. If you're someone who like quick returns and power shots, this paddle is for you
customer_reviews.author: Nick

customer_reviews.title: Great racket
customer_reviews.text: Great racket. I bought it to play with my friends and the racket is great. It has very good spin and it's great for beginners.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nit recommended
customer_reviews.text: I forgot to return it , I was charged 30$ ...I don't recommend this. Seriously I need money back
customer_reviews.author: srikrishna

customer_reviews.title: Good Product 💯
customer_reviews.text: Great for anyone starting out on any level, I got it as a gift for my dad and he loved it!
customer_reviews.author: Logan Case

customer_reviews.title: Cracking, splitting already.
customer_reviews.text: Cracking. Splitting. Not sure why after just a few weeks. Have 50+ year old paddles in similar shape.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good paddle
customer_reviews.text: Very nice paddle for the price. Great grip. The edge of one side of the rubber is starting to have small tears. Not sure why this is happening.
customer_reviews.author: dpelt73

customer_reviews.title: Great beginner paddle
customer_reviews.text: I am a recreational table tennis player, but Joola has been around for as long as I can remember. Many of their paddles are certified for professional tournament play, but I never really understood (or tried, for that matter) what made them better than the inexpensive ones I had bought at Big5 or Walmart. When I received this Joola paddle, I was surprised by how GOOD it felt in my hands. There also is a noticeable difference in the quality and workmanship over the cheaper paddles, and the control and speed are slightly better. This is a great beginner paddle! If you found this review helpful, please click the "Yes/Helpful" button to encourage me to write more. Thank you!
customer_reviews.author: Outdoor Enthusiast | Geek | Photographer

customer_reviews.title: Best brand
customer_reviews.text: So we are new to learning how to play table tennis but we have absolutely enjoyed learning. We have tried several different paddles while doing so. At first I didn't know anything about them but we have definitely learned a lot. This paddle is one of my personal favorites. As I have already mentioned, I am a beginner but have been practicing everyday. I have learned several new serves and how to put a spin and backspin on my serves. This racket feels good in your hands. I would recommend this for beginners. Also, as mentioned above we have tried several brands. Don't waste your time... buy Joola!!!
customer_reviews.author: Sadie Parker

customer_reviews.title: Recommended item
customer_reviews.text: This is a nice paddle that has a great bounce and good grip and it's affordably priced so you get everything you want in this paddle. I am no professional but i am getting better as time goes by. This paddle is comparable to some of the more expensive ones that I have used and I think it's great for beginner to advanced use. 4 stars. *If this review helped you make an informed choice about this product in any way I would appreciate it if you take a moment of your time and let me know by hitting the Helpful button and letting me know. I appreciate that you took the time to read my review, Thank you!*
customer_reviews.author: LifePathin4D

customer_reviews.title: yep, FAST
customer_reviews.text: when I read these descriptions, I think, how can a racket alter the ball THAT much... sheeesh, it does.... I learned now, with this racket, I am a speed player, I can not beat people with finess ;) I cant wear people down, I have to out hit em, and the fast your ball comes at them, the better chances of me getting that high ball I can smash... this racket has gotten more smashes by giving other player less reaction time... Love Joola descriptions, so far, they have all play out in my game.... love their rackets!!
customer_reviews.author: funbear

customer_reviews.title: Compared to the JOOLA Omega Strata
customer_reviews.text: When I hold up this racket side by side with the JOOLA Omega Strata, they look identical except for the artwork on the handle. The speed/spin/control is about the same (5-5-7 for Onega Speed vs. 6-6-8). The only real difference I can tell is the type of wood. The Omega Strata is 5-ply of kobo, bayous, and kiwi woods; while this Omega Speed is 5-ply of limba and obeche. Here are some photos of the two.
customer_reviews.author: D. Coral

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable 172 gram racket with midlevel power and spin characteristics.
customer_reviews.text: From Joola's new line of table tennis paddles, this Omega Speed racket weighs in at 172g, just a tad heavier than Joola's older SpinForce Infinity racket and playing quite similarly. The racket has a comfortable flared handle with two black rubbers. I find the overall racket to have very good playing characteristics with midrange spin and power capabilities that are perfect for a midlevel recreational player.
customer_reviews.author: Dr. Stuart Gitlow

customer_reviews.title: A good beginning racket!
customer_reviews.text: I've got a custom-made table tennis racket. So I compare any new racket to that one. All rackets can be used to hit a ping pong ball across the table. A good racket, however, allows you to consistently put a little emphasis on your shot placement. This racket by JOOLA (Omega Speed Omega Series Speed Racket) is a good beginning racket. For the best action, keep the racket face clean, and if performance begins to degrade, get yourself a new racket (perhaps time for an upgrade?).
customer_reviews.author: R S Cobblestone

customer_reviews.title: Spins and smashes
customer_reviews.text: I use this racket for recreational playing. I am able to get decent top spins, back spins, and side spins on the ball. Works good smashing the ball as well. Certainly works very well for recreational purposes. Handle is comfortable, though feels a little small (I wear size L gloves). However, I have no problems with the grip and playing with the racket, so maybe it's just getting used again to table tennis after playing regular tennis.
customer_reviews.author: J. W.

customer_reviews.title: Basic beginner paddle, illegal for competition.
customer_reviews.text: Packaging does not include rating of the speed or thickness of the sponge, but this info is included in the listing. Both rubbers are black which make the paddle illegal to use in official competitions. A fine paddle for a beginner ping pong enthusiast wanting to take the next step up, however I would personally recommend paying the extra $10 to get the Joola Omega Strata. I play in a club every week.
customer_reviews.author: GrandmaBlondie

customer_reviews.title: Always need extra ping pong paddles
customer_reviews.text: We just got the family activity center, which includes ping pong, air hockey, foosball and more. So, I wanted to make sure there were going to be enough good paddles to beat the pants off the opposing side. I will keep my personal paddle so that when we all play, they can pick whichever paddle they want. But mine will be someplace else. I am older and need the advantage over the young whippersnappers.
customer_reviews.author: CoCo's Mom

customer_reviews.title: My friends and I were impressed with the quality
customer_reviews.text: I bought this paddle along with the matching blue paddle for my new outdoor ping pong table. It feels great in my hands and although I don't know much about what makes a paddle good or not, it was balanced and easy to use. It is quality made and my friends were impressed that I had such nice paddles. I would definitely give these two thumbs up!
customer_reviews.author: H. R. Hopp

customer_reviews.title: Good Beginner's Racket - Very Good Control
customer_reviews.text: I've got a number of rackets from Joola, this is another quality one. This specific racket is ideal for when I'm not going on the offensive, but rather playing defensively until my opponent makes a mistake. If you're a shakehand player, then this racket would be to your benefit since they use limba. I'm a fan, handles well, gives me good control. Not as fast as the hinoki-wood rackets by Joola, but it serves its purpose for what I need.
customer_reviews.author: Peter Weyland

customer_reviews.title: Really well made
customer_reviews.text: This Joola Omega Speed is exceptional. It's definitely not a beginner's paddle. It's ultra responsive, the handle feels comfortable in your hand. It has so much spring that a beginner wouldn't be able to handle it. Great for advanced player. The paddle is extremely gripping and almost sticky. Quality wood, gorgeous design.
customer_reviews.author: Shauna Moreno

customer_reviews.title: Great control and fun colors
customer_reviews.text: We really like the control on this racket. The black / red opposing color sides are fun and give a little flash to your game ;) There is definitely a higher level of control than your standard recreational racket. Also, beware that these are a little heavier than your old school racket and young kids might find that they make their wrists tired.
customer_reviews.author: Truth Teller

customer_reviews.title: Quality at a Good Price
customer_reviews.text: I like the handle quite a lot. Comfortable and well-shaped. The play of the racquet is a step above typical big box store brands. Excellent racquet for average players, as it’s still controllable (pro-level racquets can be finicky) and inexpensive enough to keep a few extra for guest doubles as well. Recommended.
customer_reviews.author: New England Yankee

customer_reviews.title: Nice Racket
customer_reviews.text: I like this racket. It is comfortable to hold and play with. I have good control and get decent spin on the ball. The racket feels solid and appears to be constructed well. The layers have stayed together and have not peeled apart. I have several rackets and Joola has been consistently good.
customer_reviews.author: Morley Dotes

customer_reviews.title: I wasn't a pro until I used this paddle.
customer_reviews.text: I play about 3 times a year but after using this paddle I'm pretty sure I could take on some of these pros on Youtube. The flared handle helps me grip when I slam the ball across the table into my 12 year old kid. I love the spin you get with this paddle.
customer_reviews.author: J.P.

customer_reviews.title: Heavy handed but excellent surface control
customer_reviews.text: I liked the surface - tacky and inviting, the paddle is a little on the heavy side, which makes it a bit challenging for a beginner. The cool tacky surface however invites more advanced control and speed! This paddle is well suited for the player who wishes to progress to more competitive play.
customer_reviews.author: Etienne

customer_reviews.title: Very nice, affordable paddle
customer_reviews.text: Decided to upgrade from the basic paddles that came with my table, and what a difference. There is a tremendous difference in the feel and the action you get from the ball coming off the paddle. If you're still using those basic paddles, try one of these - you'll be glad you did.
customer_reviews.author: Kirstein Howell

customer_reviews.title: Great paddle
customer_reviews.text: I ordered several of these for my kids for their table. They lose stuff and break stuff all the time, especially the cheaper accessories. These from JOOLA seem to be very high quality. They feel good in the hand and work well. I'm very happy with them.
customer_reviews.author: AshertopiA

product_meta.title: JOOLA Omega Speed - Table Tennis Racket for Advanced Training with Flared Handle - Tournament Level Ping Pong Paddle with Torrent 33 Table Tennis Rubber- Designed for Speed
feature_bullets: JOOLA - AN OLYMPIC TABLE TENNIS BRAND TRUSTED FOR 60+ YEARS: Launched in the 1950s, JOOLA has been the proud sponsor of the biggest tournaments in the world, Including the Olympics, World Championships, and US Open. Equipment designed for all levels.

SPEED IN STYLE: The color & design of the JOOLA Omega Series Speed Ping Pong Racket meets all the elements of a professional blade and rubber to elevate your game in style. Excellent table tennis paddle for kids and adults.
DEVELOP YOUR GAME: The Omega Speed Ping Pong Paddle with its thicker 2.0mm sponge on the Torrent 33 table tennis rubber provides speed and control to help develop your strokes.

SUPERIOR QUALITY AND DURABILITY 5 PLY REAL WOOD: Only the best materials are combined together, Limba, Abachi, and Ayous, to create the perfect combo for increased speed and control. Great for the family game room.

PERFORMANCE RATINGS (SCALE 0-100) - Speed: 93, Spin: 80, Control: 85. Includes JOOLA Torrent 33 Table Tennis Rubber on both sides. Does not come with ping pong balls. Great gift for someone who already owns an indoor or outdoor JOOLA ping pong table.

Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
